titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4678) to provide more child support money to families leaving welfare, to simplify the rules governing the assignment and distribution of child support collected by States on behalf of children, to improve the collection of child support, to promote marriage, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-798, by Ms. Pryce (OH).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4678 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order. Amendment recommended by the Committee on Ways and Means now printed in the bill, modified by the amendment printed in part A of H. Rept. 106-798 shall be ocnsidered as adopted. Further amendment printed in part B of H. Rept. 106-798 sahll be separately debatable for 10 minutes.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 269.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 566.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/26/2000--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 4678 (child support funding, collection, and distribution).
